answers.answer: Hello and hope you are doing well.Your symptoms could be a side effect of the medication metformin, this can cause abdominal discomfort. Also, diabetes can cause autonomic neuropathy and affect the digestive system, leading to problems with digestion and elimination.  Besides good glycemic control, medications such as cisapride a prokinetic agent are given to promote emptying. Other causes for your symptoms could be infections like amoebiasis and malabsorption. This can be detected by a stool examination. If all organic causes have been ruled out then a diagnosis of IBS can be made. Please discuss these issues with your primary care physician when you happen to meet him. In the meantime include plenty of natural yogurt with your meals.Hope this helped and do keep us posted.

question: A month and half ago i began experiencing strange movement in my entire abdomen, i ve been pregnant before and it reminds me of a full term baby rolling around in there.  I recognized that these are not my normal gas cramps or bloating.  I have felt very bloated, lots of belching as soon as i eat, but can be belchy any time.  Doc said cramps and bloating could be from diverticulitis and treated me with cipro and flagyl, when no change i went to er. They did ct without contrast and bloodwork and said i had mild diverticulosis and to finish antbiotics.  Went back again when cramps, bloating didnt go away, this time they did a pelvic ultrasound and upper right quadrant ultrasound to check lixvliver, pancreas and gallbladder.  Only found sludge in gallbladder.  Sent me home with more pain meds.  I wejt back again when i started to feel the cramping in my stomache and esophagus.  They did chest xray, which was normal, ekg normal, and then admitted me for a colonoscopy and egd, both normal with only mild reddening of stomache so then sent home witha gastritis diagnosis. They put me on bentyl, fibercon caps.  I ve been having some pain when swallowing food, and cramping of tummy shortly after eating, but egd was normal and so was colonoscopy, wondering why i still have these rolling cramps and bloating and what could this all be?  Im on gerd meds protonix and carafate, but havent always been faithful to take them daily.  Im diabetic type 2, on metformin 1500 a day and levoxyl due to thyroidectomy 10 yrs ago.  All bloodwork and tests have been normal including two cardiolite heart tests.
title: Rolling Abdominal Cramps/Spasms?
